results.title: Faces of India: Raju, a guide from Rishikesh
results.creator_credit: Yavar Abbas and Face Film Productions
results.brief_description: Gives an intimate insight into the lives of the ordinary people in Rishikesh in the Himalayan foothills. The film follows a nine-year-old boy through a day’s work taking visitors around the town. We hear Raju giving facts and figures and details of everything he sees. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Saskatchewan 45 Below
results.creator_credit: Larry Kent, Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a picture of winter on the western prairies, when the full blast of Arctic cold strikes down upon those who live and work there. That life goes on almost without interruption is an example of human resourcefulness and adaptability, but there is no doubt of the peril ever-present in the extreme temperatures. Filmed for the most part in rural Saskatchewan, the film captures the real feel of winter—for farm people, for motorists on (or off) the road, and for animals exposed to it.

results.title: Man's effect on the environment
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Shows some of the effects of human exploitation of natural resources from the time of the earliest colonists. Raises questions as to the quality of life such environmental changes might produce.

results.title: The Musicians in the woods
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gakken Company
results.brief_description: Animated puppets enact the Grimm fairy tale about the forsaken animals who set out to make their way in the world. The adventures in which the donkey, cat, dog, and rooster outwit a band of htieves and gain a fortune is told here in colorful and amusing fashion.

results.title: The Japanese press in action
results.brief_description: The busy world of newspaper production is surveyed. It briefly introduces the daily press of Japan and the role played by it in informing the public of news and comment from home and abroad.

results.title: Doubletalk
results.creator_credit: Alan Beattie and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Shows a young man calling for his first date with a girl when he is invited in to meet her parents. The sound track reveals not only the spoken conversation, but the unspoken thoughts of all the characters.

results.title: Schefferville 4th Arctic Winter Games
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An exciting view of the Arctic Winter Games held in Schefferville, northern Quebec, in 1976. The events range from table-tennis to curling, and include six indigenous Arctic sports. The games spanned seven days of hard competition, as well as a week of sharing common northern experiences and good will. And, despite temperatures of -30C, the participants’ enthusiasm created an atmosphere of great warmth, which we witness as the losers congratulate the winners, and the winners apologise.

results.title: The Magic of animation
results.creator_credit: Rick Butler, Good Day Productions and Ontario Educational Communications Authority
results.brief_description: A look at the people and techniques involved in the production of animated films. Includes interviews with animators from the United States, Canada, France, Holland, Poland and Yugoslavia intercut with excerpts of some of their works. Written and narrated by Rick Butler, Camera by Richard Stringer, edited by David Maltby, sound by John Uhtoff and title design by Vergo.
